results.title: Simvastatin Effects on Inflammation and Platelet Activation Markers in Hypercholesterolemia
results.text_hl: Furthermore, we observed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ reduced sCD40L and sP-selectin levels as markers of @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet@@@ activation.

citations.NLM: Barale C, Frascaroli C, Senkeev R, Cavalot F, Russo I. Simvastatin Effects on Inflammation and Platelet Activation Markers in Hypercholesterolemia Biomed Res Int. 2018;2018():6508709. PMID: 30402489

results.title: Platelet hyperactivity after statin treatment discontinuation.
results.text_hl: Subjects treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ after 60 days of diet showed a significant reduction of @GENE_SELP @GENE_6403 @@@P-sel@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@ after six weeks of treatment (p < 0.01).

citations.NLM: Puccetti L, Pasqui AL, Pastorelli M, Bova G, Di Renzo M, Leo A, Cercignani M, Palazzuoli A, Auteri A, Bruni F. Platelet hyperactivity after statin treatment discontinuation. Thromb Haemost. 2003 Sep;90(3):476-82. PMID: 12958617
citations.BibTeX: @article{12958617, title={Platelet hyperactivity after statin treatment discontinuation.}, author={Puccetti L and Pasqui AL and Pastorelli M and Bova G and Di Renzo M and Leo A and Cercignani M and Palazzuoli A and Auteri A and Bruni F}, journal={Thromb Haemost}, volume={90}, number={3}, pages={476-82}}

results.title: Influence of simvastatin on aspects of thrombogenesis in CAPD patients.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@Cholesterol@@@ and low density lipoprotein fell significantly as early as after 1 month of the therapy (p < 0.001). @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@Platelet aggregation@@@ in whole blood and platelet-rich plasma was transiently decreased by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ therapy.

citations.NLM: Malyszko J, Malyszko JS, Hryszko T, Mysliwiec M. Influence of simvastatin on aspects of thrombogenesis in CAPD patients. Perit Dial Int. 2003 May-Jun;23(3):260-6. PMID: 12938827

results.title: Effect of onion and beet on plasma and liver lipids, platelet aggregation, and erythrocyte Na efflux in simvastatin treated hypercholesterolmic rats
results.text_hl: Effect of onion and beet on plasma and liver @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipids@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@, and erythrocyte @CHEMICAL_Sodium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012964 @@@Na@@@ efflux in @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treated hypercholesterolmic rats

results.title: Effects of long-term treatment with simvastatin on some hemostatic parameters in continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis patients.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Ristocetin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012310 @@@Ristocetin@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@ in PRP decreased significantly after 3 and 6 months of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ therapy.

citations.NLM: Małyszko J, Małyszko JS, Hryszko T, Myśliwiec M. Effects of long-term treatment with simvastatin on some hemostatic parameters in continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis patients. Am J Nephrol. 2001 Sep-Oct;21(5):373-7. PMID: 11684797

results.title: Effects of synvinolin on platelet aggregation and thromboxane B2 synthesis in type IIa hypercholesterolemic patients.
results.text_hl: Effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@synvinolin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Thromboxane_B2 @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013929 @@@thromboxane B2@@@ synthesis in @DISEASE_Hyperlipoproteinemia_Type_II @DISEASE_MESH:D006938 @@@type IIa hypercholesterolemic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

results.title: Cyclic nucleotides and mitogen-activated protein kinases: regulation of simvastatin in platelet activation
results.text_hl: The IC50 value of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ for @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@ induced by collagen was approximately 30 muM.

citations.NLM: Lee YM, Chen WF, Chou DS, Jayakumar T, Hou SY, Lee JJ, Hsiao G, Sheu JR. Cyclic nucleotides and mitogen-activated protein kinases: regulation of simvastatin in platelet activation J Biomed Sci. 2010 Jun 4;17(1):45. PMID: 20525309

results.title: Pravastatin and simvastatin improves acetylsalicylic acid-mediated in vitro blood platelet inhibition.
results.text_hl: In the presence of 50 muM @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@ASA@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ significantly reduced the PAC-1 expression (30% reduction for @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, P < 0 01, and 15% reduction for @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@, P < 0 01), @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@ (20% reduction for both statins, P < 0 01) and @CHEMICAL_Thromboxanes @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013931 @@@thromboxane@@@ generation (35% reduction for @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, P < 0 001, and 30% reduction for @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@, P < 0 001) compared to @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@ASA@@@ alone.

citations.NLM: Luzak B, Rywaniak J, Stanczyk L, Watala C. Pravastatin and simvastatin improves acetylsalicylic acid-mediated in vitro blood platelet inhibition. Eur J Clin Invest. 2012 Aug;42(8):864-72. PMID: 22409214
citations.BibTeX: @article{22409214, title={Pravastatin and simvastatin improves acetylsalicylic acid-mediated in vitro blood platelet inhibition.}, author={Luzak B and Rywaniak J and Stanczyk L and Watala C}, journal={Eur J Clin Invest}, volume={42}, number={8}, pages={864-72}}

results.title: Enhanced nitric oxide and cyclic GMP formation plays a role in the anti-platelet activity of simvastatin.
results.text_hl: On the contrary, inhibition of @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@ by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ was markedly attenuated (by about 50%) by addition of a nitric oxide synthase inhibitor, a NO scavenger or a NO-sensitive guanylyl cyclase inhibitor.

citations.NLM: Chou TC, Lin YF, Wu WC, Chu KM. Enhanced nitric oxide and cyclic GMP formation plays a role in the anti-platelet activity of simvastatin. Br J Pharmacol. 2008 Mar;153(6):1281-7. PMID: 18264124
citations.BibTeX: @article{18264124, title={Enhanced nitric oxide and cyclic GMP formation plays a role in the anti-platelet activity of simvastatin.}, author={Chou TC and Lin YF and Wu WC and Chu KM}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={153}, number={6}, pages={1281-7}}

results.title: Reduction of platelet cytosolic phospholipase A2 activity by atorvastatin and simvastatin: biochemical regulatory mechanisms.
results.text_hl: METHODS AND RESULTS: Washed @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ platelets were incubated with statins (1-20muM), and stimulated with collagen (1mug/ml) or @CHEMICAL_Arachidonic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D016718 @@@arachidonic acid@@@ (AA) (200muM) and TXB2 was quantified by ELISA. Incubation with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ reduced (36.2% and 31.0%, respectively) collagen-induced TXB2 synthesis (p<0.05) and @<m>DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@ (p<0.001), whereas @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ had no effects.

citations.NLM: Moscardó A, Vallés J, Latorre A, Madrid I, Santos MT. Reduction of platelet cytosolic phospholipase A2 activity by atorvastatin and simvastatin: biochemical regulatory mechanisms. Thromb Res. 2013 Apr;131(4):e154-9. PMID: 23352311
citations.BibTeX: @article{23352311, title={Reduction of platelet cytosolic phospholipase A2 activity by atorvastatin and simvastatin: biochemical regulatory mechanisms.}, author={Moscardó A and Vallés J and Latorre A and Madrid I and Santos MT}, journal={Thromb Res}, volume={131}, number={4}, pages={e154-9}}
